etl package¶

Submodules¶

etl.config module¶

Defines a Config class to read the AWS configuration from aws.ini file.

Check the aws.ini.template file configuration sections and options.

class config.Config¶

Bases: object

This class defines a wrapper for ConfigParser.

Use the aws.ini.template file as a reference to configure the application according to your AWS account settings.

Usage example:

config = Config() config.get(‘REDSHIFT’, ‘USER’)

get(section, option)¶

Reads a config option value from a section.

Retrieves an option value pertaining to the given section from the aws.ini file.

Parameters:

  • secion – The aws.ini file section name. E.g. REDSHIFT

  • option – The section config option name. E.g. PORT

Returns:

A value to the given section and option. For example:

value = config.get(‘REDSHIFT’, ‘PORT’)

etl.connection module¶

Defines a Connection class that uses Psycopg2 adapter or the AWS Redshift connector API.

The Redshift connector was used because the Psycopg2 driver was crashing unexpectedly most of the time. The Psycopg2 adapter was kept as default to satisfy the projetc requirements.

class connection.Connection(redshift=False)¶

Bases: object

This class defines a wrapper for Pycopg2 and Redshift connector API Connection classes.

Both connectors will get their configuration parameters from the Config wrapper.

Usage example:

connection = Config(redshift=True)

close()¶

Closes the adapter connection immediately.

commit()¶

Commit any pending transaction to the database.

execute(query, variables=None, commit=False)¶

Execute a database operation (query or command).

Parameters:

  • query – If True uses the Redshift connector API, otherwise use the default Psycopg2 adapter.

  • variables – Variables are specified either with positional (%s) or named (%(name)s) placeholders.

  • commit – If True Commit the transaction to the database otherwise leave it pending.

Returns:

The method returns None.

If a query was executed, the returned values can be retrieved using the corresponding cursor fetch*() methods.

etl.create_tables module¶

Defines a SchemaPipeline class to drop and create the Redshift tables.

class create_tables.SchemaPipeline(connection)¶

Bases: object

This class defines the Redshift table schema pipeline.

Code usage example with default pyscopg2 connection:

connection = Connection() pipeline = SchemaPipeline(connection) pipeline.run()

Usage example as python script with redshift connection:

python -m create_tables –redshift

create()¶

Executes all CREATE_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

drop()¶

Executes all DROP_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

run()¶

Execute all pipeline phases and print time statistics.

create_tables.main(redshift)¶

The create_tables.py script entry point.

Parameters:

redshift – If True uses the Redshift connector API, otherwise use the default Psycopg2 adapter.

etl.etl module¶

Defines the ETLPipeline class to load staging tables and insert data into the Redshift Data Warehouse tables.

class etl.ETLPipeline(connection)¶

Bases: object

This class defines the Redshift ETL pipeline.

Code usage example with default pyscopg2 connection:

connection = Connection() pipeline = ETLPipeline(connection) pipeline.run()

Usage example as python script with redshift connection:

python -m etl –redshift

insert()¶

Executes all INSERT_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

load()¶

Executes all COPY_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

run()¶

Execute all pipeline phases and print time statistics.

etl.main(redshift)¶

The etl.py script entry point.

Parameters:

redshift – If True uses the Redshift connector API, otherwise use the default Psycopg2 adapter.

etl.s3 module¶

Defines the AWS S3Loader class to read json files from buckets.

class s3.S3Loader¶

Bases: object

This class defines the AWS S3 file loader.

Usage example:

loader = S3Loader()

load_data(bucket_path, file_count=1)¶

Loads all json files from an S3 bucket.

Parameters:

  • bucket_path – The S3 bucket folder path.

  • file_count – The number of json files to load.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame object containing the data of all json files.

load_path(bucket_path)¶

Load one json file from an S3 bucket.

Parameters:

bucket_path – The S3 bucket file path.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame object containing the data of the json file.

etl.sql_queries module¶

AWS Redshift SQL query definitions.

This module defines a constant for each AWS Redshift SQL statement. Then, a list is created to group each SQL query category, such as DROP, CREATE, COPY and INSERT.

Module contents¶

Defines the ETLPipeline class to load staging tables and insert data into the Redshift Data Warehouse tables.

class etl.ETLPipeline(connection)

Bases: object

This class defines the Redshift ETL pipeline.

Code usage example with default pyscopg2 connection:

connection = Connection() pipeline = ETLPipeline(connection) pipeline.run()

Usage example as python script with redshift connection:

python -m etl –redshift

insert()

Executes all INSERT_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

load()

Executes all COPY_TABLE_QUERIES statements.

run()

Execute all pipeline phases and print time statistics.

etl.main(redshift)

The etl.py script entry point.

Parameters:

redshift – If True uses the Redshift connector API, otherwise use the default Psycopg2 adapter.
